hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Sufyan al-Thawri: I saw him on a Friday, and I saw him on another Friday upon a bier, having died during the reign of the Umayyad dynasty.

narrators.name: al-Fadl ibn Dukayn
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Ahmad al-Faddal ibn Dukayn al-Kufi

narrators.name: Sufyan al-Thawri
narrators.full_name: Sufyan ibn Sa'id ibn Masruq al-Thawri
narrators.transmissionTermMeaning: From/On the authority of (can be direct or indirect)

chainIssues: Incomplete chain - speaker is not explicitly named in the text
Use of 'an by Sufyan al-Thawri who was known for tadlis, though he is generally reliable

potential_issues.issue: Chain lacks explicit speaker identification - mawquf status unclear
potential_issues.impact: The identity of the narrator of the mawquf is not explicitly stated, creating ambiguity about the original source and authority

potential_issues.issue: Sufyan al-Thawri uses 'an (عَنْ) with unknown intermediate narrator
potential_issues.impact: While Sufyan al-Thawri is highly reliable (Thiqah Thabt), his use of 'an with unspecified sources creates potential for disconnection, though his reliability mitigates this concern

potential_issues.issue: Unidentifiable subject of observation in matn
potential_issues.impact: The hadith refers to someone ('I saw him') without clear antecedent, making the content difficult to contextualize

hadiths.english_translation: From Banu Amr ibn Sa'd ibn Ziyad Manah ibn Tamim. Ahmad ibn Abdullah ibn Yunus informed us, he said: Ma'roof was the imam of the mosque of Banu Amr ibn Sa'd, and he had a defect, and he completed the Quran during travels and at home in three nights, he led his people in prayer for sixty years without making a mistake in any prayer, because it was his concern.
